p: Further, we tested for the MIC and MMC concentrations of the solvent extract fractions ( Table 5), and we established that petroleum ether fraction against E. coli had a MIC of 250 μg/mL while methanolic fraction against S. aureus had a MIC of 125 μg/mL. In all other cases, the MIC was greater than 500 μg/mL indicating that the extract fractions were bacteriostatic in action.
